intro: Erigeron robustior, commonly known as the robust fleabane, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in open areas such as meadows and prairies, and it thrives in full sun. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers range in color from white to pale blue. Erigeron robustior is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
